intro: Clutia alaternoides, commonly known as the African nightshade, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and potatoes. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by berries containing toxic seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. Due to its toxic properties, it is not typically cultivated for ornamental or edible purposes.
